thread.title: Manchester United news: Anthony Martial can score 25 a season, says Paul Scholes | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United news: Anthony Martial can score 25 a season, says Paul Scholes | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United news: Anthony Martial can score 25 a season, says Paul Scholes | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 8:38 pm "He has 25 goals a season in him…" 
Scholes expects big things out of @AnthonyMartial …but just not yet. #UEL https://t.co/g3GsbFCCqO 
— BT Sport Football (@btsportfootball) February 16, 2017 
Manchester United legend Paul Scholes says he expects Anthony Martial to score around 25 goals a season if he gets his confidence and form back. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
The France international has been inconsistent in his second season at Old Trafford, but showed what he’s capable of in his first year when he finished as top scorer on 17 goals. 
United will now hope the 21-year-old can rediscover that form after a strong return to the first-team fold against Watford at the weekend, when he scored one and set up the other in a 2-0 win. Anthony Martial has 7 goals so far this season (Picture: Getty) 
Scholes believes confidence is key for Martial, and once he gets going he could be the consistent source of goals the Red Devils need. 
‘We’ve seen that he’s capable of scoring goals, beating players, but we’re not seeing it enough,’ Scholes told BT Sport. 
‘He’s still a young player, we have to remember that and when you look at wide players they’re always the most inconsistent on the pitch anyway.
